dc:bibliographicCitation: Ross, Pawley and Osmond. The lexicon of Proto Oceanic
dc:title: The lexicon of Proto Oceanic

columns.dc:description: Description of the meaning of the word (possibly in language-specific terms).
columns.name: Description

columns.dc:description: For a form that differs from the expected reflex in some way this flag asserts that a copying mistake has not occurred.
columns.name: Sic

columns.dc:description: In particular reconstructions, i.e. proto-forms in etymological dictionaries, are often marked as being somewhat doubtful (typically displayed as proto-form prefixed with a '?' or similar).
columns.name: Doubt

columns.dc:description: Some forms (often multi-word expressions) are listed with morpheme glosses.
columns.name: Morpheme_Gloss

columns.dc:description: Abbreviation for the (proto-)language name.
columns.name: Abbr

columns.dc:description: Etymological dictionaries often operate with an assumed internal classification. This column lists such groups.
columns.name: Group

columns.dc:description: Etymological (or comparative) dictionaries typically compare lexical data from many source dictionaries.
columns.name: Source

columns.dc:description: Specifies whether a language is a proto-language (and thus its forms reconstructed proto-forms).
columns.name: Is_Proto

columns.dc:description: Classification within Oceanic, given as /-separated nodes.
columns.name: Classification

columns.dc:description: A recognizable label for the cognateset, typically the reconstructed proto-form and the reconstructed meaning.
columns.name: Name

columns.dc:description: Links to the reconstructed proto-form in FormTable.
columns.name: Form_ID

columns.dc:description: Flag indicating (un)certainty of the reconstruction.
columns.name: Doubt

tables.dc:description: Etymological dictionaries sometimes mention "negative" results, e.g. groups of lexemes that appear to be cognates but are (temporarily) dismissed as proper cognates; for example the "noise" and "near" categories in the ACD. This includes the better defined category of loans where members of the group will be listed in BorrowingTable.

columns.dc:description: The title of a table of related forms; typically hints at the type of relation between the forms or between the group of forms and an etymon.
columns.name: Name

columns.dc:description: An optional category for groups of forms such as "loans".
columns.name: Category

columns.dc:description: Links to an etymon, if the group of lexemes is related to one.
columns.name: Cognateset_ID

tables.dc:description: Membership of forms in a "cf" group is mediated through this association table unless more meaningful alternatives are available, like BorrowingTable for loans.

columns.dc:description: The example text in the source language.
columns.name: Primary_Text

columns.dc:description: The sequence of words of the primary text to be aligned with glosses
columns.name: Analyzed_Word

columns.dc:description: The sequence of glosses aligned with the words of the primary text
columns.name: Gloss

columns.dc:description: The translation of the example text in a meta language
columns.name: Translated_Text

columns.dc:description: References the language of the translated text
columns.name: Meta_Language_ID

columns.dc:description: The level of conformance of the example with the Leipzig Glossing Rules
columns.name: LGR_Conformance

columns.dc:description: Links to the form in FormTable.
columns.name: Form_ID

columns.dc:description: Name of tree as used in the tree file, i.e. the tree label in a Nexus file or the 1-based index of the tree in a newick file
columns.name: Name

columns.dc:description: Describe the method that was used to create the tree, etc.
columns.name: Description

columns.dc:description: Whether the tree is rooted (Yes) or unrooted (No) (or no info is available (null))
columns.name: Tree_Is_Rooted

columns.dc:description: Whether the tree is a summary (or consensus) tree, i.e. can be analysed in isolation, or whether it is a sample, resulting from a method that creates multiple trees
columns.name: Tree_Type

columns.dc:description: The unit used to measure evolutionary time in phylogenetic trees.
columns.name: Tree_Branch_Length_Unit

columns.dc:description: References a file containing a Newick representation of the tree, labeled with identifiers as described in the LanguageTable (the [Media_Type](https://cldf.clld.org/v1.0/terms.html#mediaType) column of this table should provide enough information to chose the appropriate tool to read the newick)
columns.name: Media_ID
